intro: Vicia boissieri, commonly known as the Boissier's vetch, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to regions of southern Europe and western Asia, often found in rocky or arid environments. The plant features slender, climbing stems with small, pinnate leaves and produces yellow or reddish-purple pea-like flowers. Its seeds are enclosed in elongated pods, typical of the Fabaceae family. Vicia boissieri is noted for its ability to fix atmospheric nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility in its natural habitat.
